0.title: Sweet Potato Pie
0.description: Shared from a Southern recipe, this homemade sweet potato pie is easy to make with boiled sweet potato. Try it, it may just be the best you've ever tasted!
instructions: Place whole sweet potato in pot and cover with water; bring to a boil. Boil until tender when pierced with a fork, 40 to 50 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Remove sweet potato from the pot and run under cold water. Remove and discard skin.

Break sweet potato flesh apart and place in a bowl. Add butter and mix with an electric mixer until well combined. Add sugar, milk, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla; beat on medium speed until mixture is smooth. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool before serving.

1.title: Fresh Southern Peach Cobbler
1.description: A delicious Southern peach cobbler made with fresh peaches and a simple biscuit topping. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine peaches, sugars, butter, vanilla, and cinnamon.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In another bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in milk until just combined. Drop spoonfuls over peach mixture.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden brown.

2.title: Best Southern Fried Chicken
2.description: This is my family recipe for fried chicken that makes the best fried chicken I have ever tasted!
ingredients: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces
instructions: Combine flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika in a shallow bowl.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or large skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Coat chicken pieces in flour mixture.
Carefully place chicken in hot oil and fry until golden brown and cooked through, approximately 15 minutes.
Place chicken on paper towels to drain excess grease.
